text:
35 YO male,  primarily [** 1195**] speaking, Pt lives with siblings in [**Location (un) **] he works full time at [**Company **], was healthy active person
   but  had not been felling well,  having fever, chills, malaise seen by
   multiple MDs. On Cipro x 2days for UTI, later switched to Amox. Pt
   developed cough, pleuritic chest pain, SOB, orthopnea 2 days prior to
   admission, temp up to 103. [**11-11**] started on po Cipro for leukocytes in
   urine, temp spike. [**11-12**] continued tachypnea, tachycardia. Temp spike
   to 102. High grade bacteremia [**5-5**] bc pos for GPC in pairs +clusters.
   TEE done. Preliminary  report w/ severe AR w/ flail leaflet. ?abcess in
   annules, mild MR. [**First Name (Titles) **] [**Last Name (Titles) 2656**].  Pt has congenital aortic valve malformation
   which made him more a candidate for Endocarditis. Bld for multiple
   serology labs sent, also daily blood cultures.  [**11-14**] Surgery
   consulted->  Repeat  echo done today  Wednesday [**11-15**] showed worsening
   hypertrophy and valve compromise,  ID consulted today, dental xrays
   done , head imaging and CT chest/abd/pelvis to eval for septic emboli
   also done this afternoon, look for reports in careweb, . [**Name8 (MD) 2717**] MD
   met with family and with interpreter, a family [**Last Name (un) 2718**],  pt sister and
   Next of [**Doctor First Name **]: Sister [**Name (NI) 2701**] [**Telephone/Fax (1) 2702**], They discussed treatment
   options and because of his worsening heart failure Pt may have surgery
   tomorrow in AM.  Social services encouraged pt to fill out HCP, and
   forms are in room, in [**Name (NI) 1195**] and pt sister will likely be elected.  PT
   tolerated trips to CT and XRAY, remains tired, somewhat anxious, quiet
   but OX3 and converses. Able to get oob, transfers to chair with asiist
   of two, tolerating being on 6L for most of the day but will wear mask
   PRN. Did desaturate in CT scan to 80
s improved with supplemental O2,
   He barely tolerated laying flat coughing a lot, spitting up but no
   evidence that he vomited.   His aline is very poitional and mostly
   inaccurate, intern updated regarding that. Pt now comfortable, resting
   in chair, captopril held due to lowish BP today, and pt taking his
   Flagyl  for CDIFF, and on increased dose vanco for low levels.
   .H/O acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome (ARDS, Acute Lung Injury, [**Doctor Last Name 11**])
   Assessment:
   RR 30-40, but tolerating 6L NC for most of day. supplemental O2, PRN,
   coughing in CT scan when laying flat otherwise o2 sats pretty stable.
   Action:
   Continue wean o2 as tolerated, reassure pt.
   Response:
   PT states his breathing has improved.
   Plan:
   Follow sats unable to get blood gas Aline ? clotted/vs positional.
   Endocarditis, Bacterial
   Assessment:
   Tmax today 100.9 oral, blood cultures sent x 2 ,  started flagy for
   Cdiff, increased Vancomycin doses, and genta 180 mg  q 8, as before..
   neuron intact, no abd pain, nailbeds clear no sign of septic emboli.
   Action:
   Follow temp, cultures. Continue assess for emboli, CV and resp neuro
   status
   Response:
   Pt stable, taking po fluids, Tylenol around the clock.
   Plan:
   Continue antibiotics follow levels. Tylenol, NPO after midnight
